Homage to Jewel Lotus Wonderful Abiding Mountain King Buddha May all the Buddhas of the ten directions who appear in the world and uphold the teachings in the various worlds observe and have compassion for me.

Whether in this life or in other lives, from beginningless time I have extensively committed various offenses, either doing them myself, rejoicing in others doing them, or encouraging others to do them;
Or I have stolen Buddha's property, the property of the fourfold assembly, either doing it myself, rejoicing in others doing it, or encouraging others to do it;
Or I have committed the five heinous crimes or the ten unwholesome courses of action, either doing them myself, rejoicing in others doing them, or encouraging others to do them.

Due to these karmic hindrances, my body and mind are obscured, and I am born in the eight difficult circumstances, either falling into the hells, animal realms, or ghost realms, or being born in borderlands or among barbarians, or being born in the long-lived heavens. Even if I obtain a human body, my faculties are incomplete, or I give rise to wrong views denying cause and effect, or I am averse to the Buddhas appearing in the world.

In this way, all karmic hindrances, I now repent before all Buddha-World-Honored Ones, those endowed with omniscience, those endowed with the five eyes, those who have realized the ultimate truth, those who weigh and measure, those who know and see, I now repent with a sincere mind, not daring to conceal anything, and wish that my precepts and discipline may be restored as before.

I also wish that all Buddha-World-Honored Ones will accept and protect me, and bear witness to me. If in this life or other lives, since beginningless time in the cycle of birth and death, I have ever made offerings to even a single animal, or upheld a single pure precept, or cultivated the wholesome roots of pure conduct, or cultivated the wholesome roots of the unsurpassed wisdom to a small extent, I vow to gather them all together and calculate them.
Just as all Buddhas of the three times in the supreme unsurpassed vow of dedication dedicate all to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
Repenting of all offenses, rejoicing in all merits,
And exhorting the Buddhas to attain supreme wisdom,
The Honored Ones among humans of the past, present, and future,
The ocean of immeasurable merits, I now bow my head in reverence.
